#summary archive_write_free 3 manual page
== NAME ==
*archive_write_close*,
*archive_write_finish*,
*archive_write_free*
- functions for creating archives
== SYNOPSIS ==
*#include <archive.h>*
<br>
*int*
<br>
*archive_write_close*(_struct archive `*`_);
<br>
*int*
<br>
*archive_write_finish*(_struct archive `*`_);
<br>
*int*
<br>
*archive_write_free*(_struct archive `*`_);
== DESCRIPTION ==
<dl>
<dt>*archive_write_close*()</dt><dd>
Complete the archive and invoke the close callback.
</dd><dt>*archive_write_finish*()</dt><dd>
This is a deprecated synonym for
*archive_write_free*().
</dd><dt>*archive_write_free*()</dt><dd>
Invokes
*archive_write_close*()
if necessary, then releases all resources.
If you need detailed information about
*archive_write_close*()
failures, you should be careful to call it separately, as
you cannot obtain error information after
*archive_write_free*()
returns.
</dd></dl>
== RETURN VALUES ==
These functions return
*ARCHIVE_OK*
on success, or
*ARCHIVE_FATAL*.
== ERRORS ==
Detailed error codes and textual descriptions are available from the
*archive_errno*()
and
*archive_error_string*()
functions.
